title: Jabran Rafique
intro: Senior Software Engineer with over a decade of experience in developing high-performance, scalable web applications. Demonstrates expertise in agile development, code optimization, and enhancing user experience. Passionate about integrating cutting-edge technologies to drive transformative web solutions and align technical initiatives with business goals.

employments.intro: I am involved in maintaining NBCUniversal & Sky customers streaming account platforms in 3 continents covering US, Europe and Africa.
experience: Maintain Sky's online portfolio across the US, Europe, and Africa, enhancing platform performance.
Led performance improvements for the web apps driving results through strategic and technical enhancements
Led test-driven development and developer experience initiatives, resulting in measurable improvements and optimized workflows.
Mentor engineers, fostering technical skill growth and career progression.
Provide strategic technical leadership and guidance, aligning with business goals.
Collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders to drive impactful technical decisions.

employments.intro: As a Staff Engineer, I inherited a majority of responsibilities from my previous Tech Lead role and expand to encompass broader responsibilities such as strategic planning, and technical directions.
experience: Guided strategic planning and technical direction, aligning engineering efforts with long-term business goals and market trends.
Led migration of legacy web apps to ReactJS and NodeJS ecosystem, enhancing performance and reliability.
Oversaw CI/CD pipelines with BitBucket, Bamboo, AWS, and Cloudflare, ensuring continuous development and seamless deployments.
Led and drove web performance enhancements using tools like Lighthouse and WebPageTest, achieving up to 55% speed improvements across the web platform.
Championed progressive web app technologies, revolutionizing mobile user experience and substantially increasing engagement metrics.
Cultivated a culture of continuous learning and technical excellence through mentorship, elevating team capabilities and fostering innovation.

employments.intro: As a Front-end Tech Lead, I was adept at mentoring and managing teams, driving modernization efforts, and ensuring code quality and platform health.
experience: Led REST API development in NodeJS and Redis for user authentication serving just over half a million requests a day as a proxy to Java microservices.
Spearheaded micro-frontend migration using ReactJS, NodeJS, and Remix, enhancing system performance and user experience for Rated People's digital platforms.
Partnered with cross-functional teams to drive technical improvements, leveraging Cloudflare Workers, VWO, and SEOClarity for enhanced user testing and A/B experiments.
Cultivated engineering excellence by mentoring front-end developers, elevating code quality standards, and optimizing workflow automation processes.
Implemented comprehensive monitoring systems with AppDynamics, Heap, and Site24x7, ensuring platform stability and swift issue resolution.
Actively shaped a high-performing engineering team through active involvement in recruitment, aligning talent acquisition with long-term technical goals.

employments.intro: Involved in planning and development of new features and maintaining the existing codebases by keeping up with best practices, performance, security and industry standards.
experience: Actively participated in front-end stack migration to AWS, enhancing performance and scalability.
Actively participated in platform rebranding in 2016, improving user engagement and brand perception.
Modernized front-end tools chain to boost developer experience.
Spearheaded and developed a new front-end app using LAMP stack and Symfony2, revolutionizing customer signup and vetting processes.
Pioneered cutting-edge UI/UX designs that enhanced user engagement and site functionality.
Pioneered the adoption of Docker and AWS technologies, revolutionizing deployment strategies and significantly enhancing scalability and reliability.

employments.intro: Oversee the social apps and websites development for clients, mentor and manage the development team and maintain technical roadmap.
experience: Enforced rigorous quality standards in code and documentation, ensuring robust and maintainable applications across diverse client projects.
Spearheaded the adoption of cutting-edge technologies, guiding the team on industry trends and elevating the company's technical capabilities.
Mentored junior developers and freelancers, fostering a culture of knowledge sharing and driving team productivity in agile development sprints.
Pioneered MVC frameworks for custom web apps, enhancing code reusability and streamlining development processes for high-profile clients.
Optimized in-house social media application frameworks, significantly improving performance and user engagement for client platforms.
Partnered with design leads and project managers to maintain development sprints, ensuring seamless project execution for high-profile clients.

freelancing.description: I developed a Role-Based Access Control (RBAC) platform in LAM(PHP) stack to monitor countrywide fibre-optic operations internally. The monitoring platform extensively used Google Maps API underneath with drawings API on top of it to add lines and station data to showcase service status in real-time. The source of data was the emails generated by the stations on service updates.
I developed the website, designed branding and an internal logistics consignment system using LAM(PHP) stack that had helped me learn advance aspects of web development.

I designed the wireframes and prototypes. Based on these designs, I developed the website and inventory UI for electro-mechanical material related to the aerospace industry using open-source technologies LAM(PHP).

projects.description: I develop apps based on personal ideas and interests in my spare time. Most of my projects are open-sourced and the code is hosted at GitHub. Some of these projects are:

data.name: Reason to Follow
data.description: A browser extension for remembering reasons to follow accounts on social platforms.

data.name: Childcare Vouchers
data.description: A directory of businesses accepting childcare vouchers as payment.

data.name: Guess Where
data.description: A geo quiz app built with HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and Google Maps API.

data.name: Work Clock
data.description: MacOS menu bar utility app written in Swift for remote work in different timezones.

data.name: Google Maps API React Hook
data.description: Custom React hook to integrate Google Maps JavaScript SDK in React apps.

data.name: Facebook API React Hook
data.description: Custom React hook to integrate Facebook JavaScript SDK in React apps.

data.name: Covidonation
data.description: Directory of organizations helping during the COVID-19 pandemic.

data.name: Covid19 Today
data.description: Daily updated figures for COVID-19 for every country and continent.

data.name: Socialmedia.js
data.description: A JavaScript library that simplifies the social media integration into the web apps. It has a comprehensive documentation covering setup and usage for various supportive social media platforms.

data.name: Fetchwitter
data.description: An easy-to-use PHP client to authenticate and consume Twitter API in web apps. Fetchwitter exposes a small and simple API to fetch Tweets and perform searches with terms such as a hashtag. It also has a WordPress plugin for easy integration into WordPress.

data.name: CSV Parser
data.description: A PHP client to parse CSV data from a file, stream, or string and convert into indexed or associative array format.

data.name: JS Memcache
data.description: A lightweight JavaScript in-memory cache to store data for better performance by saving on network requests.

volunteering: Contributed to Google's Map Maker project (2008-2013) to map unmapped areas, focusing on developing countries. Served in various community-leading positions, guiding a global community of mappers, setting regional mapping standards, organizing events, and leading training sessions.
For more information, visit Google LatLng Blog.
